content.question: Ana opened a bank account with $1000 that earns interest, compounded continuously, at an annual rate of <math alttext="r equals, 0.02" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.02</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Money can be withdrawn from the account at regular intervals, and no additions to the account can be made. The function <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> models the balance of the account, in dollars, at time <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. Assume that Ana withdraws money from the account continuously at a rate of <math alttext="N" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>N</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> dollars per year. Which of the following differential equations best describes the relationship between <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="the derivative of P, with respect to t, equals, 0.02 P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>0.02</mn><mi>P</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the derivative of P, with respect to t, equals, 0.02 P, plus 1000" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>0.02</mn><mi>P</mi></mrow></mstyle><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn><mtext>000</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the derivative of P, with respect to t, equals, 0.02 times, open parenthesis, P minus N, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>0.02</mn><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>P</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>N</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the derivative of P, with respect to t, equals, 0.02 P, minus N" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>0.02</mn><mi>P</mi></mrow></mstyle><mo>−</mo><mi>N</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the derivative of P, with respect to t, equals, 0.02 P, minus N" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>0.02</mn><mi>P</mi></mrow></mstyle><mo>−</mo><mi>N</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>
